Description: Polished black-topped redware pottery bowl with radiating palm-leaf design in burnish on interior base. Vessel walls rippled vertically on the interior and exterior. Repaired from fragments.
Curator's comments: The decoration is burnished as a fine line on the otherwise dull, unpolished interior surface on the base. Brunton's Black-topped Red class BR3D. Made of very fine Nile Silt A.
Bibliographic references: Brunton & Caton-Thompson 1928 / The Badarian Civilisation and Predynastic Remains near Badari (22; pl. xiv.3D, xxv.5)
Acquisition name: Donated by: British School of Archaeology, Egypt
